definition: a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
surname Gong
radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 2)
see 豎筆|竖笔[shu4 bi3]
variant of 吊唁[diao4 yan4]
to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
with only body and shadow to comfort each other (idiom)/extremely sad and lonely
to hold memorial service/to hold a funeral
to visit the bereaved to offer one's condolences
a worship ceremony for the dead/to offer sacrifice (to ancestors)/a libation
a condolence visit
a visitor offering condolences
to console the people by punishing the tyrants (idiom)
to offer condolences/to console the bereaved
to console the people by punishing the tyrants (abbr. for 弔民伐罪|吊民伐罪[diao4 min2 fa2 zui4])
to revisit the past/to commemorate
paper prayers for the dead burnt at funerals
to grieve for the sick and the dying/to show great concern for people's suffering
bizarre/paradoxical/a paradox (from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子)

sentences.english: Language is always full of eeriness and ambiguity.
sentences.chinese: 語言總是充滿了弔詭和歧義。

sentences.english: Neck medium in length, clean and strong, not throaty.
sentences.chinese: 頸部中等長度，整潔且結實，無弔喉。

sentences.english: The airport is full of contradictions and paradoxes.
sentences.chinese: 這座機場充滿了矛盾和弔詭。

sentences.english: But it was often unclear to me what the word professionalism meant.
sentences.chinese: 但是對於我而言，專業化是個弔詭的名詞。

sentences.english: To know oneself was paradoxically the way to self-renunciation.
sentences.chinese: 瞭解自己很弔詭地導致自我剋制。

sentences.english: Messagers should neither be headed nor be hanged.
sentences.chinese: 這個好理解，不斬頭也不弔起來。

sentences.english: As far as these paradoxes are concerned, the garden is definitely a heterotopia .
sentences.chinese: 就這些弔詭性而言，花園無疑地是個異質空間。

definition: have as remainder/trad. variant of 剩[sheng4]
square/strongly (as of emotion)
to fall/meteor/to perish/see also 殞|殒[yun3]

a funeral/to encoffin a corpse/to carry to burial
